intro: Pimpinella reuteriana, commonly known as the European cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is found in Europe and parts of Asia. It is often mistaken for other members of the carrot family due to its similar appearance. Pimpinella reuteriana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
